Numbers matching, Stock has dings and dents from many years of training exercises and drills.

title: For Sale:  WTS/WTT Rem 700 .223 in Accuracy International AICS 1.5 Chassis w/ 3 Mags
postcontent:
Hey there. Gun is located in Waco. Will accept cash FTF. Will ship on buyer's dime within TX.

I have decided to sell one of my target guns. I have shot 1/2" groups at 100 and 5/8" groups at 200 with 53 grain Hornady VMax's.

The barreled action is a special release Remington 700 VTR in .223. Normal VTR's have a 22" triangular barrel with a factory muzzle break; my rifle has a 26" triangular barrel with no break. I have all the paperwork and (probably) the original box.

The trigger has been professionally tuned and breaks at a crisp 2 pounds.

The barreled action is bolted into an Accuracy International AICS 1.5 chassis system. I have painted the stock and it looks great (see pictures below). This thing is rock solid.

The rifle comes with three AI ten-round mags.

The bipod, mount, rings, and scope are not included unless otherwise negotiated.

The gun, trigger work, AICS and (3) AI mags - $1450 OBRO.
Can add the Harris S-series 9-13" bipod for $50.
Can include the Leupold Mark 4 mount for $100.
Can add a Custom / Professionally cut Pelican 1750 for $200. 

Will trade for:
- Rem Versa Max + Cash as necessary
- Browning Maxus + Cash as necessary
- Rem 870 Mag + Cash as necessary
- Benelli M2 or SBE II + Cash if necessary

title: For Sale:  Anti-Personnel 44 Mag. Ammo - 180 gr. Medium Cast HP-GC (1,550 fps) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=243

These Anti-Personnel 44 magnum loads were designed for the owners of 44 magnum firearms that choose to use those firearms for defense against humans. Both loads feature light weight, hollow nosed bullets, designed to mushroom dramatically at the intended impact velocities. Item # 4H will perform on humans much like our DEER GRENADE load (Item # 4F) performs on game animals. The light-for-caliber weight of these bullets, aids in reduced felt recoil, for faster follow-up shots. We've employed flash suppressed powders but, with any bullet moving this fast from typical length revolvers, there is still a decent flash in low light.

Both of these loads will also work well on light, big game such as whitetail deer.

Both of these loads are safe to use in ALL/ANY 44 mag. firearm that is in normal operating condition.

Note our real world velocities taken from my personal stock firearms. We prefer to establish our advertised velocities from over-the-counter, stock firearms, while most ammunition companies establish their published velocities from laboratory, long, test barrels, which provide false or exaggeratedly high readings. We feel that this long established practice does not give the customer a true idea of what the ammunition is doing when fired from 'real world guns' under 'real world conditions,' where these numbers really do matter.

title: For Trade:  UZI RIFLE    only licensed .22lr in production
postcontent:
It's nearly new, very low round count:     It is a Licensed UZI rifle with folding/expanding stock. It is the only Licensed IWI Israeli  UZI  in .22LR calber that is in production in the world. It is imported/distributed by Walther.
It is heavy, like 9 pounds heavy, it's nearly all metal.
The steel stock folds and locks up tight in closed position to form a pistol length UZI, then expands again and locks into place to form a full size rifle.
It has a foregrip with built in Bipod and also a super bright Lithium powered rail mounted flashlight with quick-release(mounts to the rail on the side of the foregrip).
It comes with a Pitbull padded case and a "bungee"  sling that clips to the swivel point that is installed on the UZI. The swivel moves to two different spots on the UZI.
It has never malfunctioned ...at all... in any way; and it has zero blemishes. It is the same as new. It is  quite a machine.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Greatest SKS Build Ever
postcontent:
Yugoslavian SKS type 59/66 with brand new railed TAPCO furniture, (2) 20 and 30 round magazines, mountable pistol grip, geletin butt-pad, and TAPCO strap. One of the simplest, most reliable, small arms ever designed with a brand new comfortable setup. This rifle rivals the Ruger Mini 30 in accuracy, design, firepower, modularity, and cost.  

Clean, straight barrel, clean bore, clean bolt, clean pin, clean gas tube, clean piston, clean trigger mech, clean furniture, fresh mags, no cosmoline, no rust, no weird smell, ready to shoot. 

Bolt modified to allow the mag to release even when bolt is seated to the bore. The bolt DOES NOT have to be pulled back to release mag. (very convenient) No effect on accuracy, I hit a 1 1/2 inch .22 target circle 3 times in a row at roughly 75 yards and absolutely destroyed it. 

Theres extras. Within the water-proof buttstock, are several things necessary for this gun to last; a brand new firing pin recoil spring, and cleaning jag and fresh gas-piston tube with rail. 

 Furniture in olive drab, mountable pistol grip in olive drab, strap in black, gel butt-pad in black, magazines are black. All aftermarket parts are made in USA and made by TAPCO (with exception of butt-pad and Promag 30rd magazine)

no felons, minors, crazies, or shady people. must be able to show valid nevada i.d. all federal, nevada, clark county, and las vegas laws to be followed.

title: For Sale:  Savage 10 Predator with Choate Ultimate Varmint stock,5 round detachable mag and Nikon scope.
location: Chicago and Canal, Grand Rapids, Michigan
postcontent:
This is my Varmint rifle. I need to sell it because I don't have a varmint problem and I have an AR. It weighs about 14 lbs and still has room for a lb or 2 of lead shot in the stock. The scope is a Nikon 4.5-14x40mm with BDC reticle that can be used for a variety of common calibers. The Choate stock is made of DuPont Rhynite and takes paint very well. Has a nice wide flat forearm, bipod adapter, sling adapters for right or left side carry. This rifle is nice and heavy for the bench and it touches off like a bb gun. The lack of recoil allows you to see exactly what's going on down range because it doesn't change your sight picture. You can literally watch your varmints blow up. 
 The trigger is of course an accutrigger so it's not the greatest but it's a lot better than your average deer gun. As for accuracy it's a savage. It will put the 50gr Hornady Vmax that I load with a measly 25gr of BLC2 inside a dime at 100 meters all day.

Now with that being said I have a very good price on it. If I don't sell this gun a week from today I'll just take the listing down and nobody wins that way. I'm not going a penny lower than 700. This is one hell of a varmint gun and the shit is a steal at that price.

title: For Sale:  1944 Springfield Armory M1 Garand w/ ammo
postcontent:
I am look to sell my Springfield Armory M1 Garand. Receiver dates to January 1944, and it was rebarrelled in March 1952. It is a CMP Greek Return that would rate at well above Service Grade. Muzzle has a fresh 11 degree crown put in it, and reads approximately a "2" on the M2 bullet test. I have put National Match front and rear sights on it. The rear sight has 1/2 M.O.A. adjustable elevation, and the front sight has a .062" post. I will include the standard sights as well. I have done a substantial amount of work to this rifle to accurize it, including floating the rear handguard, peening the gas system to the barrel, and the recrown. As long as the stock sights are put back on, it is John Garand match legal. I stripped this rifle 100%, cleaned and oiled every part, and refinished the stock by stripping it and putting on a fresh coat of Boiled Linseed Oil. This rifle is awesome and is super clean.

I am including 200 rounds of American Eagle .30-06 150grn M2 Ball, 5 enbloc clips, a S.L.E.D., and the standard G.I. sights. All that you need is a sling to start doing some serious shooting!

Asking $1050 for everything. Will not sell separately at this time. Yes, of course, it's C&R, cash and carry. I may be willing to ship for the right price.

title: For Sale:  Springfield M1A .308 Win. National Match Sight, Walnut Boyds stock, GI type sling, two mags.
postcontent: This a like new M1A by Springfield Armory with some accuracy upgrades. The Boyd Walnut stock is fit to a very tight tolerance for best receiver support during firing, while still maintaining ease of cleaning and field stripping as it is not glass bedded. National match 595 rear sight by Springfield is graduated in .5 MOA increments instead of the usual 1 MOA, this makes for much finer tuning of downwind point of impact, especially at range. Front sight is also a National match .062 post with military type prong guards. The Bolt has been lapped to the receiver for full bearing on both locking lugs. This is the single most important gunsmithing upgrade to do to an M1A. It provides the most stable lockup possible for reliability, precision, and accuracy. Chamber was maintained at about 1.63 inches, which is pretty consistent with military specs. The sling is a standard quick adjust webbed GI type black sling. I still have a Springfield box, paperwork, chamber flag etc... for it. I am including the two match type 5 round mags. These are desirable for long range competition shooting as they keep down the weight and bulk while the shooter is "slung up." As I understand they are also legal for hunting.  I have sighted this for perfect point elevation adjustments using the elevation markings and M80 Ball ammo. I have fired it out to 400 yards with very impressive results. I just don't do enough long range shooting, someone needs to be able to stretch this guns legs a bit. I am in need of cash so no trades at this time. Thanks for the look and let me know if you have any questions.

SAM7K-01 Arsenal AK Pistol 7.62x39mm - NEW IN BOX! - never fired, still in oil and plastic!

The SAM7K PISTOL

Arsenal’s Exclusive Milled And Forged Receiver
Each SAM7K receiver is milled from a hot-die hammer forged receiver blank by the Arsenal Co. of Bulgaria. Other milled-receiver AKs are machined from bar stock, but Arsenal’s hot-die hammer forging produces stronger and finer-grained steel. Internal voids and cooling deformations are eliminated by the 5-ton hammer forging process.

Each forged receiver blank requires over 5.5 hours of milling before assembly. This forging and milling process is complex and time-intensive, but Arsenal’s meticulous attention to detail delivers a receiver of unequalled strength, precision and durability

Summary: SAM7K - 7.62x39mm caliber Pistol, milled receiver (hot-die hammer forged), short gas system, front sight block / gas block combination, 10 1/2 inch chrome lined hammer forged barrel, black polymer furniture, original pistol grip made to work with ambidextrous safety lever, and peep rear sight, scope rail. Includes one 5-round magazine, sling, oil bottle, and cleaning kit.

title: For Sale:  FIE E-22 .22LR semi auto
postcontent:
For sale is an FIE .22 LR semi auto pistol, Model E-22, in good condition. This includes the pistol with one magazine.  This is a cheap .22 that is a fun range gun.  Like most .22 pistols, it is ammo finicky and needs high velocity ammo.  I've put 50 rounds or so through it and had the occasional light strike but all then fired with a second strike. Also the rare failure to extract the fired case. So it is a good cheap range toy but NOT a defensive pistol. It is possible a thorough cleaning of the firing pin channel, main spring, etc. could clear up the light strikes. 

If this ad is open, it is available. Will only sell FTF around Evansville

title: For Sale:  S&W Victory .38 spl revolver
postcontent:
For sale is a Smith and Wesson .38 spl Victory Model. 1950's conversion with the barrel cut to 2", the lanyard loop hole filled in and the pistol nickel plated. the cylinder has been bored out to .38 special specs. This was a very common conversion done by distributors post WWII to make the surplus models more appealing. Interestingly, it was a similar converted Victory model which Lee Harvey Oswald shot Officer Tibbs and  had with him when arrested. 

Price drop to $235. This is as low as I can go and I am not shipping.

In Evansville only.  I will NOT ship.  I will not drive 3 hours and have someone cancel.

The action is tight with minimal cylinder twist and the trigger is smooth, typical for this model and vintage. This would make a great range or truck gun. Better than a new Rossi or Taurus. Serial # V46XXXXI. 

I will want to see an IN DL and LTCH. If this ad is open, it is available.
